results.title: It's so easy. - [rev. ed.]
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Demonstrates correct practices for safety in small boats. Illustrates common types of accidents and their prevention, maintenance, life jackets, safety harness and survival swimming.

results.title: It's so easy
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Deals with the basic rules of safety at sea. Emphasises the need to be aware of the dangers. Always check gear, don’t overload, carry a radio for any warning of weather change, state destination before departing, and obey the rules of the “water road”. Outlines technique of survival swimming.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Crombie, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: It's Ruth
results.brief_description: A biography of Ruth Cracknell, the renowned Australian actor whose career has spanned half a century. While her work encompasses all genres and mediums she is best known for her comic roles, especially that of Maggie Bear in the long running ABC television series ‘Mother and Son’. In this documentary, interviews with various associates and friends focus on the eccentric elements of her work and her ability to juxtapose the tragic and the comic in her performances. Excerpts from ‘Mother and Son’, Beckett’s play ‘Happy Days’, Elizabeth Jolley’s short story ‘Woman in a Lampshade, Oscar Wilde’s play ‘The Importance of Being Ernest’ and Neil Simon’s play ‘Lost in Yonkers’ are included.

results.title: It's our's whatever they say
results.brief_description: A fatal accident to a child provokes the parents on a council estate into fighting for the provision of an adventure playground. The film is shot as a newsreel, tracing the day by day advances and setbacks of the tenants.

results.title: It's not easy
results.creator_credit: Judy Rymer, Sandra Alexander, Film Australia and Inland Films
results.brief_description: Made in association with the Family Court of Australia, this program looks at the effect on children of broken marriages, and the way that the Family Courts can counsel parents. Three case studies illustrate different problems and how they can be solved.

results.title: It's not always happy at my home (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A dramatised account of domestic violence in a middle class American family. Aimed, in part, at children, this video treats issues at a personal level, and touches on a number of relevant issues such as role stereotypes, counselling, refuges and peer support.

results.title: It's not all rubbish
results.brief_description: This video provides information about recycling. By following the investigation undertaken by Brunswick East High School students, viewers will learn a great deal about how paper, glass, metal, plastic and vegetable matter is recycled. Recycling plants are visited, processes are demonstrated and explained and end products are shown. The main value of this video, however, is to demonstrate graphically how students can become motivated and actively involved in improving their own environment.

results.title: It's no longer a secret
results.brief_description: A motivational film during which three people talk about the difference learning to read has made to them; why they failed to learn at school and how they came to follow the BBC ‘On the move’ program.

results.title: It's Marty!
results.creator_credit: Dennis Main-Wilson, Michael Mills, Roger Race and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Marty Feldman was the goggle-eyed clown whose innovative slap-stick humour helped usher in the anarchic age of Monty Python. Part Chaplin, part Keaton, part Python, he was the scriptwriter of “Round the Horne” for radio and “Bootsie and Snudge” for TV - who turned comic to take Hollywood by storm in movies with Mel Brooks & Gene Wilder, such as Young Frankenstein, Silent Movie and Yellowbeard. This video is a compilation of some of the very best of Marty Feldman, taken between the years of 1968 & 1969. It includes famous and often controversial sketches - The Cabbie ‘Squadron, The Loneliness of the long distance golfer, - these and others put his zany, surreal style on the map. The scriptwriters read like a roll-call of British comedy - Barry Took, John Cleese, Michael Palin, Terry Jones, Graham Chapman, and topping the list is Feldman himself. But then this is his show, a fitting tribute to a comic iconoclast. (Due to the archive nature of the material the sound and picture quality may vary occasionally, please do not adjust your set.)

results.title: It's like that
results.creator_credit: Dell Stewart, Diana Ward, Elizabeth McLennan, Emma Kelly, Justine Wallace, Kate Matthews, Louise Craddock, Nicole McKinnon, Sally Gross, Sharon Parker, Sophie Raymond, Susan Earl, Yuki Wada and Southern Ladies Animation Group
results.brief_description: This beautifully moving and poignant film depicts the plight and emotions of children held in Australian mandatory detention centres, seeking refugee status. Over a series of evocative animated images, one hears an array of children’s voices, describing their experiences of migrating from overseas and their detention in Australia. The children depicted as caged, migratory birds, reflect upon their environment, treatment and future. These interviews, conducted with three children being held in centres, clearly express the trauma of their experiences (both journeying to and once in Australia) and are heart-rending in their evocation of innocence abused. On completion of this film, in October 2003, these children remained in mandatory detention, awaiting their claims for refugee status to be processed.
